item.title: PhilHealth denies paying out P600-M in denied claims to hospitals
item.description: The Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) on Friday belied allegations that it has paid out P600 million in denied claims to hospitals under an amnesty program.

item.title: Thailand races to contact trace as coronavirus reappears
item.description: Thailand reported its first non-imported case in after over 100 days on Thursday, after a prisoner a day earlier had tested positive for the coronavirus during a mandatory test for new inmates.

item.title: Lacson: Pouring white sand along Manila Bay worthwhile endeavor
item.description: Senator Panfilo Lacson on Friday said the Department of Environment and Natural Resources' decision to pour white sand along the shores of Manila Bay as part of the rehabilitation plan is "worthwhile," so long as prudent planning was employed.

item.title: DOJ to ask court to reconsider Pemberton release
item.description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) said Friday it will file its own motion asking an Olongapo court to reconsider its order for the release of convicted US Marine Joseph Scott Pemberton.

item.title: Philippines reports 3,714 new COVID-19 cases, total now at 232,072
item.description: The number of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases in the country rose to 232,072 on Friday after the Department of Health (DOH) announced 3,714 new infections.

item.title: Alan Cayetano hits MTRCB over bid to 'regulate' Netflix
item.description: "This is the kind of bureaucratic thinking that gives government workers a bad name," House Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano said in a statement posted on his Facebook page."Ang dami na ngang problema ng mga kababayan natin, tapos ito pa ang gustong unahin ng MTRCB?"

item.title: Health measures must be in place to ensure safety of tourists amid COVID-19 pandemic -- Palace
item.description: “The President s marching order is to gradually reopen the economy, including the tourism sector, with the assurance that health and safety measures are in place,” presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said.

item.title: Curevac COVID-19 vaccine scale production seen this year -investor
item.description: BERLIN - German biotechnology firm Curevac expects to be able to produce the COVID-19 vaccine it is developing at scale by the end of the year, investor Dietmar Hopp told the Handelsblatt business daily on Friday.

item.title: AFP objects to rights group's claim of escalating attacks vs IPs
item.description: The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) on Friday objected to remarks made by Indigenous Peoples Rights International (IPRI) denouncing the alleged "escalating attacks" by the military against indigenous peoples.

item.title: 3 arrested for abandoning elderly woman under Manila bridge
item.description: Police in Manila on Friday said they have arrested the man who abandoned the elderly woman found under the MacArthur Bridge earlier this week.

item.title: DepEd, private schools oppose academic freeze amid COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: The Department of Education (DepEd) and the Coordinating Council of Private Educational Associations (COCOPEA) on Friday said they are against an academic freeze this school year amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: 300k Pag-IBIG members availed of loan relief amid COVID-19 crisis -exec
item.description: Some 300,000 Pag-IBIG members have benefited from a three-month moratorium on loan payments, the government financial institution said Friday.

item.title: Delayed Avigan clinical trials to start within September --DOH
item.description: "We target to start ngayong September, we are just now naghihintay ng mga pending documents for processing," Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said in an online forum.

item.title: 2nd rescued crewman dies, records reveal defects with cattle ship sunk off Japan
item.description: TOKYO - Japan's coast guard said the second survivor of a capsized cattle ship on its way to China from New Zealand, who had been pulled unconscious from the waters of the East China Sea on Friday, had died.

item.title: Pemberton lawyer: BuCor officers attested to convicted US Marine s good conduct
item.description: The lawyer of US Marine Joseph Scott Pemberton, who was found guilty of killing Jennifer Laude in 2014, on Friday said corrections officers have attested to the "good conduct" of the American serviceman.
